remarks.para: For square pixels, the X and Y fields of the FocalLength should be the same. The units of the focal length fields are pixels per meter, so dividing the width and height of the image by the X and Y fields of the focal length, respectively, yields the physical size in meters of the image at a distance of one meter from the sensor.
The PrincipalPoint field is expressed in pixels, not in normalized coordinates. The origin [0,0] is the bottom, left corner of the image.
